{"Date":"2021-01-30T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":83.33000183105469,"Notes":["Decision previously made on 13 Dec 2020 is extended until 14 Feb 2021.  “According to this decision, schools will, as a rule, remain closed or children will continue not to be required to attend classes at school. The same approach will be taken for daycare centres.”  Source: https://archive.fo/Rh2k1","\"The Minister of Labour and Social Affairs will issue a regulation, initially limited until 15 March, according to which employers must allow their employees to work from home wherever possible, provided that their work permits this.\"  Source: https://archive.fo/Rh2k1","Since gatherings are restricted at 10 people and less, public events are not allowed.  \"Religious gatherings are only permitted under strict conditions, including keeping distance from others, wearing masks, also medical masks, and the prohibition of congregational singing. Gatherings with more than ten participants must be reported to the relevant office responsible for public order at least two working days in advance, unless the religious community in question has already made general arrangements with specific authorities.\"  Source: https://archive.fo/Rh2k1","\"The rules for private gatherings – one household with another person who is not part of the same household – remain in place.\"  Source: https://archive.fo/Rh2k1 ","No law in place but recommended to avoid public transport during rush hour by using options for working from home.  \"Firstly, by making extensive use of options for working from home – we’re lagging far behind the figures we had in March of last year here – by doing everything we can to reduce volumes of passengers during rush hours in commuter and school traffic, and secondly by making it compulsory to wear medical masks.\"  Source: https://archive.fo/Rh2k1 ","No nationwide curfew in place, but some individual federal states have implemented curfews.  - Bayern: \"Accordingly, all existing measures such as the contact restrictions, the night-time curfew as well as the 15-km radius for so-called corona hotspots will continue to apply until mid-February.\" (http://web.archive.org/web/20210205170659if_/https://www.br.de/nachrichten/deutschland-welt/coronavirus-in-bavaria-assistance-in-english,RtO8eS2)  - Saxony  - Hessen  - Baden-Württemberg  - Berlin  - Brandenburg  - Thuringia  Source: https://archive.fo/jQteO","All measures extended to 14 Feb 2021.   \"In regional districts with a 7-day incidence of over 200 new infections per 100,000 inhabitants, the Länder will take further local measures in accordance with the Infection Protection Act (Infektionsschutzgesetz), in particular restricting people’s movement to a radius of 15km around their place of residence, where there is no valid reason for exceeding this. Day trips and tourist excursions are explicitly not a valid reason.\"  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210126231018/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1834616/414f0f73976e720fd7fb7b33c74b30fb/2021-01-05-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf ","Travel restrictions apply for entry from a large number of countries.  In principle, entry is possible from:  •\tEU member states  •\tstates associated with Schengen: Iceland, Norway, Switzerland and Liechtenstein  •\tOther countries, from which entry is possible due to the epidemiological situation assessment by the EU.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210202120840/https://www.auswaertiges-amt.de/en/einreiseundaufenthalt/coronavirus","No changes, all measures are extended to 14 Feb.  \"Interim assistance III to be further improved.\"  Source:   http://web.archive.org/web/20210128132328/https://www.bundeskanzlerin.de/bkin-en/news/decision-of-federal-and-state-governments-1841104  https://web.archive.org/web/20210126231018/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1834616/414f0f73976e720fd7fb7b33c74b30fb/2021-01-05-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf (statement released on 5 Jan)","No new measures regarding this announced.  Source: https://archive.fo/Rh2k1","Coordinated website with latest information, measures, vaccination schedule etc.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210205172406/https://www.bundesregierung.de/breg-de/themen/coronavirus  ","Testing is only required for symptomatic people who fall under certain risk groups, or when recommended by the primary doctor, asymptomatic people in close contact with someone who has tested positive.  \"PCR test should be performed  •\tif the patient has severe respiratory symptoms such as bronchitis or pneumonia, shortness of breath or fever,  •\tif the patient suffers from a disorder of the sense of smell and taste,  •\tif the patient has had contact with a confirmed COVID-19 case,  •\tif symptoms worsen.  A test can also be performed for symptoms such as a slight cough.  It is tested for mild respiratory symptoms, in particular (but not exclusively):  •\twho belongs to a risk group,  •\twho works in nursing, a doctor's office or hospital,  •\tAnyone who was exposed, i.e. , for example, was with over 10 people in a closed and poorly ventilated room,  •\tAnyone who has had contact with a person with unexplained acute illnesses (e.g. fever) and is in a district with an increased 7-day incidence (> 35 / 100,000 inhabitants),  •\twho has or will have close contact with many people or with high-risk patients.\"    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210205062130/https://www.rki.de/DE/Content/InfAZ/N/Neuartiges_Coronavirus/Teststrategie/Nat-Teststrat.html","Contact tracing app in place but the government noted that the high number of infections has made contact tracing impossible as coded on 5 Jan 2021.  Currently no new information as to whether contact tracing is more effective now.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210205172822/https://www.bundesregierung.de/breg-de/themen/corona-warn-app/corona-warn-app-englisch","\"We have extended the obligation to wear medical masks, i.e. surgical masks or FFP2 or KN95/N95 masks, in order to have a greater protective impact. This applies to public transport and shops, where wearing such masks is mandatory. In general, the use of medical masks is also advised in situations where there is closer or prolonged contact with other people.\"    Source: https://archive.fo/Rh2k1 ","A, C (both BioNTech/Pfizer and Moderna)  Currently, only people in Group 1 can be vaccinated:  •\tOver 80 year olds  •\tPeople who are treated, cared for or cared for in inpatient facilities for older people or people in need of care, or who work,  •\tNursing staff in outpatient care services  •\tEmployees in medical facilities with a high exposure risk such as intensive care units, emergency rooms, rescue services, as service providers of specialized outpatient palliative care, corona vaccination centers and in areas with infection-related activities  •\tEmployees in medical facilities who treat, care for or care for people at high risk (especially hemato-oncology and transplant medicine.)    *AstraZeneca vaccine is approved in Germany and EU, but only used for people under 65 y/o – hence currently not used since only priority group 1 is being vaccinated    Source: https://archive.fo/dpmeE","Measures remain the same: “Special protective measures must be taken in care homes and nursing homes.”  https://web.archive.org/web/20210126231018/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1834616/414f0f73976e720fd7fb7b33c74b30fb/2021-01-05-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf "]}

{"Date":"2021-02-03T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":83.33000183105469,"Notes":["Not recorded monetary spending, but Germany launches Corona emergency aid for Portugal.  \"German Armed Forces will provide paramedics and respirators to help Portugal, which has been largely sealed off, in the Corona pandemic. According to the Ministry of Defence, it is planned to initially provide the EU partner with 26 medical personnel as well as 150 field hospital beds and a total of 50 respirators. The assistance is to be provided in a hospital.\"  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210126230736/https://www.deutschland.de/en/news/coronavirus-in-germany-informations"]}

{"Date":"2021-02-24T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":81.4800033569336,"Notes":["\"Partly as a result of the amount of unused Oxford/AstraZeneca supplies, the health ministry has altered its priority lists of who should be vaccinated so that teachers and carers from schools and kindergartens are eligible to receive one from Wednesday. {"Date":"2021-03-03T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":77.77999877929688,"Notes":["***These measures released March 3:  “Bookshops, florists and garden centres will be treated uniformly as retail for daily needs in all Länder” and can reopen.  They are subject to appropriate hygiene concepts and a limit of one customer per 10 square metres for the first 800 square metres of retail space, plus one customer for each additional 20 square metres.  “The remaining personal care service providers as well as driving schools and flight schools can also reopen with appropriate hygiene concepts, whereby a COVID-19 rapid test or self-administered test by the customer performed that day and a testing concept for the staff are required for the use of services in which a mask cannot be worn permanently - such as for cosmetics or shaving.”   Regulations for remaining sectors will be extended until 30 April 2021: “Employers must enable employees to work from home, provided that their work tasks permit this.”  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210307092502/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1873218/700fb03e258c9bdd15e80a69c7ad3dfe/2021-03-03-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1"]}

They are subject to appropriate hygiene concepts and a limit of one customer per 10 square metres for the first 800 square metres of retail space, plus one customer for each additional 20 square metres.    “The remaining personal care service providers as well as driving schools and flight schools can also reopen with appropriate hygiene concepts, whereby a COVID-19 rapid test or self-administered test by the customer performed that day and a testing concept for the staff are required for the use of services in which a mask cannot be worn permanently - such as for cosmetics or shaving.”     Regulations for remaining sectors will be extended until 30 April 2021: “Employers must enable employees to work from home, provided that their work tasks permit this.”    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210307092502/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1873218/700fb03e258c9bdd15e80a69c7ad3dfe/2021-03-03-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1","No policy change.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210307092502/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1873218/700fb03e258c9bdd15e80a69c7ad3dfe/2021-03-03-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1","“The possibilities for private gatherings with friends and relatives will be expanded again from 8 March: private gatherings of one’s own household and another household will be possible, but limited to a maximum of five people. Children up to the age of 14 are not included in this limit. Couples are considered to be one household.”    Depending on the number of infections in each region, the restrictions for private gatherings can be further expanded or tightened.  -\tIn regions with a 7-day incidence of less than 35 new infections per week, the possibilities for private gatherings can be expanded to one’s own household and two additional households, with a maximum total of ten people. Children up to the age of 14 are not counted as part of this figure.  -\tIf the 7-day incidence per 100,000 inhabitants increases to more than 100 on three consecutive days in any Land or region, the rules that applied until 7 March will come into force again there from the second following working day (emergency brake). Afterwards, the possibility for private gatherings will once again be restricted to one's own household and one other person. Children up to the age of 14 are not included in this limit.     Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210307092502/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1873218/700fb03e258c9bdd15e80a69c7ad3dfe/2021-03-03-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1","No policy change.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210307092502/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1873218/700fb03e258c9bdd15e80a69c7ad3dfe/2021-03-03-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1","No policy change.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210307092502/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1873218/700fb03e258c9bdd15e80a69c7ad3dfe/2021-03-03-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1","15 km radius still applies for states with a 7-day incidence of more than 200 per 100,000 (e.g. Berlin). {"Date":"2021-04-23T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":75.0,"Notes":["Nationwide emergency brake came into force on 23 April, which will allow for standardisation of measures among the states.  Previously, individual states could decide on the measures to be implemented.  According to the nationwide emergency brake, there can be no in-person teaching if 7-day incidence > 165.  Since there are some states with 7-day incidence > 165, I have coded this as 3T.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210424103726/https://oscovida.github.io/germany-incidence-rate.html  http://web.archive.org/web/20210424104907/https://www.bundesregierung.de/breg-en/news/nationwide-emergency-brake-1889136","Food stores including direct sales may open, along with beverage retailers, health food stores, specialised baby needs stores, pharmacies, medical equipment and supplies stores, drug stores, opticians, hearing testing and hearing aid specialists, petrol stations, newspaper sellers, bookstores, flower shops, pet supplies stores, animal food markets, garden centres and wholesalers. In all cases, these businesses may only open if they have an appropriate hygiene concept, and face masks will be mandatory.  Where the incidence is under 150 all other shops will be allowed to offer customers appointments to shop, provided they supply evidence that they have tested negative. In the services sector, everything that is not specifically prohibited may remain open, including bicycle and car workshops, banks, post offices etc.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210424104907/https://www.bundesregierung.de/breg-en/news/nationwide-emergency-brake-1889136","No change in policy. {"Date":"2021-08-01T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":64.80999755859375,"Notes":["Starting 1 Aug, risk areas will be classified in two categories: high risk areas and virus variant areas. The category of “simple” risk areas does not apply. Now all those entering - regardless of whether they have been in a high-risk area or virus variant area or not - are obliged to provide evidence of the absence of an infection with the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus (vaccination, test -, proof of recovery). Non-vaccinated or those untested are required to undergo quarantine regulations if they are entering Germany from a risk area. (The Coronavirus Entry Ordinance of 30 July, 2021)     Sources:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210823175326/https://www.bundesgesundheitsministerium.de/service/gesetze-und-verordnungen/guv-19-lp/coronaeinreisev.html  "]}

{"Date":"2021-08-20T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":56.47999954223633,"Notes":["In Berlin- Private meetings indoors are permitted without any limits on the amount of people attending. Outside gatherings are allowed for a maximum of 100 people. Your own children up to 14 years of age as well as vaccinated and recovered persons are not included. The permitted number of people at special celebrations is 50 persons indoors and 100 persons outdoors.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210820042720/https://www.berlin.de/corona/en/measures/"]}

{"Date":"2021-08-23T00:00:00.000Z","StringencyIndex":56.47999954223633,"Notes":["23 Aug starts the \"3G Rule\" where certain public spaces are only open to those that are vaccinated, recovered, or tested - (geimpft, genesen, getestet). This rule enables more businesses to open or operate at higher capacity. There are still the basic rules of social distancing, observing hand hygiene, wearing face masks indoors and regular ventilation of indoor spaces    Sources  https://web.archive.org/web/20210823181430/https://www.bundesregierung.de/breg-en/news/federal-regional-consultation-coronavirus-1949666    https://web.archive.org/web/20210823182454/https://www.iamexpat.de/expat-info/german-expat-news/3g-rule-comes-force-across-germany-what-you-need-know","23 Aug starts the \"3G Rule\" where certain public spaces are only open to those that are vaccinated, recovered, or tested - (geimpft, genesen, getestet). There are still the basic rules of social distancing, observing hand hygiene, wearing face masks indoors and regular ventilation of indoor spaces    Sources  https://web.archive.org/web/20210823181430/https://www.bundesregierung.de/breg-en/news/federal-regional-consultation-coronavirus-1949666    https://web.archive.org/web/20210823182454/https://www.iamexpat.de/expat-info/german-expat-news/3g-rule-comes-force-across-germany-what-you-need-know"]}
